snippet: Mr. Trump’s White House run blurs the line between campaigning and brand-building and complicates his claims that he is funding his own campaign.
abstract: Filings with Federal Election Commission reveal Donald J Trump's presidential campaign spent $12.4 million in 2015, far less than any of his competitors for Republican nomination; additional amount of around $2.7 million was paid to at least seven companies Trump owns or to people employed through his companies and brands who contributed services to campaign.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and SARAH COHEN
byline.contributor: Nicholas Confessore reported from Manchester, and Sarah Cohen from New York. Maggie Haberman and Jeremy B. Merrill contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump’s White House run blurs the line between campaigning and brand-building and complicates his claims that he is funding his own campaign.

headline.main: Donald Trump’s Campaign, Billed as Self-Funded, Risks Little of His Fortune
headline.print_headline: Trump’s Bid Is Going Easy on His Wallet
